intro: Jatropha rumicifolia, commonly known as the stinging leaf or stinging plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves that can cause a tingling or stinging sensation when touched. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Jatropha rumicifolia is also known for its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
